column6: Interreligious Perspectives on Health and Medicine
column7: Explores and develops an appreciation for the many ways in which religion and religious identities are present in, and absent from, medical spaces in the United States. This course is intended to support physicians-in-training develop the background, vocabulary, and experiences necessary to practice medicine thoughtfully and sensitively in a religiously diverse society. No graduate credit. 4 professional hours. Approved for S/U grading only.
column9: No graduate credit. 4 professional hours. Approved for S/U grading only.
